paper.title: Phase-curve Evidence for an Atmosphere on TRAPPIST-1 b

core_question: Whether TRAPPIST-1 b retains any atmosphere under strong stellar irradiation, using JWST phase-curve spectroscopy to jointly constrain heat transport and composition.

datasets_or_cohorts.label: TRAPPIST-1 b JWST MIRI phase-curve spectroscopy
datasets_or_cohorts.sample_size_or_observations: One planet observed over an orbital phase curve with phase-resolved thermal spectra
datasets_or_cohorts.description: Thermal phase variation and spectral structure around the 15 um CO2 band are measured with JWST MIRI low-resolution spectroscopy to infer atmospheric and heat-transport properties.

datasets_or_cohorts.label: Bare-rock, no-atmosphere model (null scenario)
datasets_or_cohorts.sample_size_or_observations: Model comparator for the same phase-curve dataset
datasets_or_cohorts.description: An atmosphere-free interpretation assuming minimal heat redistribution is used as a baseline to test whether an airless surface can explain both the phase amplitude and spectral behavior.

datasets_or_cohorts.label: CO2-rich atmosphere retrieval family
datasets_or_cohorts.sample_size_or_observations: Model family fit to phase-curve + spectrum
datasets_or_cohorts.description: Atmosphere-bearing retrieval models with significant greenhouse gas absorption are compared against the null to assess whether CO2-related spectral structure and redistribution are supported.

datasets_or_cohorts.label: O2-rich atmosphere retrieval family
datasets_or_cohorts.sample_size_or_observations: Model family fit to phase-curve + spectrum
datasets_or_cohorts.description: Oxidized-composition atmosphere scenarios with weaker CO2 signature constraints are evaluated as alternative explanations that may not be fully excluded by the present data.

major_limitations: Single-planet study; does not establish prevalence across M-dwarf rocky planets.
Retrieval assumptions (circulation, opacity priors, cloud treatment) affect posteriors.
Stellar variability and instrument systematics can bias weak spectral features.
Night-side constraints are weaker than day-side constraints in the current dataset.
Degeneracies between composition, clouds/hazes, and circulation assumptions remain significant.
